conclusion: The force of gravitational weight acting down the slope (component of mg) is F₉ = mg sin θ.
The electrostatic repulsion on sphere A due to sphere B is horizontal and equals Fₑ = k q²/d².
The angle between the horizontal force Fₑ and the surface of the incline is θ, so the component of Fₑ along the slope is Fₑ, slope = Fₑ cos θ.

premise: Because the wire tension is zero, equilibrium of A along the incline requires Fₑ, slope = F₉.
conclusion: k q²/d² · cos θ = mg sin θ.

premise: k q²/d² · cos θ = mg sin θ.
